canonical.name: Tchi Tchi
canonical.title: 63. Tchi Tchi / After The Achievement
canonical.judgment: Tchi Tchi intimates progress and success in small matters. There will be advantage in being firm and correct. There has been good fortune in the beginning; there may be disorder in the end.
canonical.image: The trigram representing fire, and that for water above it, form Tchi Tchi. The superior person, in accordance with this, thinks of evil that may come, and beforehand guards against it.

1.text: shows as a driver who drags back their wheel, or as a fox which has wet their tail. There will be no error.

2.text: shows as a wife who has lost her carriage-screen. There is no occasion to go in pursuit of it. In seven days she will find it.

3.text: suggests the case of Ko Chung who attacked the Demon region, but was three years in subduing it. Small men should not be employed in such enterprises.

4.text: shows its subject with rags provided against any leak in their boat, and on their guard all day long.

5.text: shows  the neighbour in the east who slaughters an ox for their sacrifice; but this is not equal to the small spring sacrifice of the neighbour in the west, whose sincerity receives the blessing.

6.text: shows its subject with even their head immersed. The position is perilous.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
